verses.verse: And Jacob <WH3290> lifted up <WH5375> his eyes, <WH5869> and looked, <WH7200> and, behold, <WH2009> Esau <WH6215> came, <WH935> and with <WH5973> him four <WH702> hundred <WH3967> men. <WH376> And he divided <WH2673> <WH853> the children <WH3206> unto <WH5921> Leah, <WH3812> and unto <WH5921> Rachel, <WH7354> and unto <WH5921> the two <WH8147> handmaids. <WH8198>

And he put <WH7760> <WH853> the handmaids <WH8198> and their children <WH3206> foremost, <WH7223> and Leah <WH3812> and her children <WH3206> after, <WH314> and Rachel <WH7354> and Joseph <WH3130> hindmost. <WH314>

And he <WH1931> passed over <WH5674> before <WH6440> them, and bowed himself <WH7812> to the ground <WH776> seven <WH7651> times, <WH6471> until <WH5704> he came near <WH5066> to <WH5704> his brother. <WH251>
And Esau <WH6215> ran <WH7323> to meet <WH7125> him, and embraced <WH2263> him, and fell <WH5307> on <WH5921> his neck, <WH6677> and kissed <WH5401> him: and they wept. <WH1058>

And he lifted up <WH5375> <WH853> his eyes, <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> <WH853> the women <WH802> and the children; <WH3206> and said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> are those <WH428> with thee? And he said, <WH559> The children <WH3206> which <WH834> God <WH430> hath graciously given <WH2603> <WH853> thy servant. <WH5650>
Then the handmaidens <WH8198> came near, <WH5066> they <WH2007> and their children, <WH3206> and they bowed themselves. <WH7812>

And Leah <WH3812> also <WH1571> with her children <WH3206> came near, <WH5066> and bowed themselves: <WH7812> and after <WH310> came Joseph near <WH5066> <WH3130> and Rachel, <WH7354> and they bowed themselves. <WH7812>

And he said, <WH559> What <WH4310> meanest thou by all <WH3605> this <WH2088> drove <WH4264> which <WH834> I met? <WH6298> And he said, <WH559> These are to find <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in the sight <WH5869> of my lord. <WH113>
And Esau <WH6215> said, <WH559> I have <WH3426> enough, <WH7227> my brother; <WH251> keep <WH1961> that <WH834> thou hast unto thyself.

And Jacob <WH3290> said, <WH559> Nay, <WH408> I pray thee, <WH4994> if <WH518> now <WH4994> I have found <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in thy sight, <WH5869> then receive <WH3947> my present <WH4503> at my hand: <WH4480> <WH3027> for <WH3588> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> I have seen <WH7200> thy face, <WH6440> as though I had seen <WH7200> the face <WH6440> of God, <WH430> and thou wast pleased <WH7521> with me.

Take, <WH3947> I pray thee, <WH4994> <WH853> my blessing <WH1293> that <WH834> is brought <WH935> to thee; because <WH3588> God <WH430> hath dealt graciously <WH2603> with me, and because <WH3588> I have <WH3426> enough. <WH3605> And he urged <WH6484> him, and he took <WH3947> it.
And he said, <WH559> Let us take our journey, <WH5265> and let us go, <WH1980> and I will go <WH1980> before <WH5048> thee.

And he said <WH559> unto <WH413> him, My lord <WH113> knoweth <WH3045> that <WH3588> the children <WH3206> are tender, <WH7390> and the flocks <WH6629> and herds <WH1241> with young <WH5763> are with <WH5921> me: and if men should overdrive <WH1849> them one <WH259> day, <WH3117> all <WH3605> the flock <WH6629> will die. <WH4191>

Let my lord, <WH113> I pray thee, <WH4994> pass over <WH5674> before <WH6440> his servant: <WH5650> and I <WH589> will lead on <WH5095> softly, <WH328> according as <WH7272> the cattle <WH4399> that <WH834> goeth before <WH6440> me and the children <WH3206> be able to endure, <WH7272> until <WH5704> <WH834> I come <WH935> unto <WH413> my lord <WH113> unto Seir. <WH8165>

And Esau <WH6215> said, <WH559> Let me now <WH4994> leave <WH3322> with <WH5973> thee some of <WH4480> the folk <WH5971> that <WH834> are with <WH854> me. And he said, <WH559> What <WH4100> needeth it? <WH2088> let me find <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in the sight <WH5869> of my lord. <WH113>
So Esau <WH6215> returned <WH7725> that <WH1931> day <WH3117> on his way <WH1870> unto Seir. <WH8165>

And Jacob <WH3290> journeyed <WH5265> to Succoth, <WH5523> and built <WH1129> him a house, <WH1004> and made <WH6213> booths <WH5521> for his cattle: <WH4735> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the name <WH8034> of the place <WH4725> is called <WH7121> Succoth. <WH5523>

And Jacob <WH3290> came <WH935> to Shalem, <WH8003> a city <WH5892> of Shechem, <WH7927> which <WH834> is in the land <WH776> of Canaan, <WH3667> when he came <WH935> from Padan-aram; <WH4480> <WH6307> and pitched his tent <WH2583> <WH853> before <WH6440> the city. <WH5892>

And he bought <WH7069> <WH853> a parcel <WH2513> of a field, <WH7704> where <WH834> <WH8033> he had spread <WH5186> his tent, <WH168> at the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of the children <WH1121> of Hamor, <WH2544> Shechem's <WH7928> father, <WH1> for a hundred <WH3967> pieces of money. <WH7192>
And he erected <WH5324> there <WH8033> an altar, <WH4196> and called <WH7121> it El-elohe-Israel. <WH415>
